abstract: The deal between the two crosstown Atlanta rivals will make Southern the second-largest United States utility, with about nine million customers.
snippet: The deal between the two crosstown Atlanta rivals will make Southern the second-largest United States utility, with about nine million customers.
lead_paragraph: Southern Company’s acquisition of AGL Resources could yet find its true north. The power producer is buying its crosstown Atlanta rival for $12 billion, including $4 billion of debt. Although the premium looks rich for the utility sector, there is at least a chance that the price can be justified.

headline.main: Southern Company to Pay $12 Billion for AGL Resources
